content: swirly hat a slight variation on my simply spirals hat which creates a more dramatic twist to the spiral like simply spirals this hat is worked in joined rounds except single_crochet rounds which are worked in the spiral unjoined rounds in this pattern a round will simply begin with a double_crochet what you choose for this is up to you you may ch2 or ch3 my personal favorite technique is to use the no turning chain double_crochet tutorial available on youtube materials needed fingering weight yarn e hook 3 5mm yarn needle begin with magic_ring round 1 12 double_crochet into magic_ring - 12dc round 2 double_crochet ch1 into each double_crochet - 12dc 12ch round 3 slip_stitch into chain space 2dc ch1 in ea ch1 space - 24dc 12ch round 4 slip_stitch into chain space 2 slip_stitch 3dc in chain space chain 1 12x - 36dc 12ch round 5 slip_stitch into next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in next double_crochet 3dc in chain space chain 1 skip 2dc 12x - 48dc 12ch round 6 slip_stitch into next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in ea next 2dc 3dc in chain space chain 1 skip 2dc 12x - 60dc 12ch round 7 slip_stitch into next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in ea next 3dc 3dc in chain space chain 1 skip 2dc 12x - 72dc 12ch round 8 slip_stitch into next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in ea next 4dc 3dc in chain space chain 1 skip 2dc 12x - 84dc 12ch rounds 9-20 slip_stitch into next 2 double_crochet double_crochet in ea next 5dc 2dc in chain space chain 1 skip 2dc 12x - 84dc 12ch round 21 chain 1 single_crochet into ea next 6dc decrease single_crochet into ea next 7dc single_crochet into chain space 6x - 90sc round 22 single_crochet around - 90sc slip_stitch into next single_crochet cut yarn finish off and weave in ends gauge first 4 rounds = 3 if you re not getting my gauge or if you want to up-size the hook and yarn follow the directions for the increases the same but stop increasing when the diameter of your circle hits about 7
